title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic jokes about speaking to Carlo Ancelotti over Napoli move
text:
Zlatan Ibrahimovic has refused to confirm whether Carlo Ancelotti has called him about joining Napoli.

Ibrahimovic's contract with LA Galaxy expires in December and there have been suggestions that he could return to Italy, with Ancelotti joking about bringing him back to the country on Saturday evening.

And the Swedish striker gave a light-hearted response when asked whether he had already been phoned by his former manager.

Zlatan Ibrahimovic refused to confirm whether Carlo Ancelotti called him about joining Napoli

Ancelotti joked about potentially bringing the Swedish striker back to Italy over the weekend

'Everyone calls me. You want my number also? So you can call me also? Okay, we'll fix it,' he said to a reporter when asked whether Ancelotti had given him a ring.

The same reporter then suggested he should stay in MLS as he has scored 52 goals in just 57 appearances for Galaxy.

Ibrahimovic did not seem opposed to the idea, responding: 'Thank you, I appreciate it'.

The 38-year-old has previously played for Juventus, Inter Milan and AC Milan in Italy, the latter under Ancelotti.
